messages: I'm a teapot, not a request-handling machine. Take a break!
This teapot is full. Try again in {seconds} seconds.
Brewing too many requests. Cool down!
Error 418: I'm a teapot and I refuse to brew your requests right now.
The teapot has spoken: slow down, human.
I'm short and stout, but I can't handle this many requests.
Tip me over? More like tip your request rate down!
Steam overflow detected. Lid pressure critical.
My spout is blocked. Please wait {seconds} seconds.
Kettle overload! Even teapots need rest.
You've been steeping too many requests. Time for a tea break!
This teapot is on strike until you slow down.
418: Too hot to handle. Let me cool off.
Warning: Teapot approaching thermal runaway.
I may be a teapot, but I'm not your personal espresso machine.
The tea leaves have predicted: you shall wait {seconds} seconds.
Pouring requests faster than I can steep!
My handle can't take this heat. Back off!
British engineers designed me for tea, not this abuse.
RFC 2324 Section 2.3.2: I'm a teapot. Deal with it.
Error: Attempted to brew coffee with a teapot.
I've lost my cozy. Now I'm cold AND rate-limited.
Steeped in too many requests. Infusion denied.
The Earl Grey has left the pot. Try again later.
I'm experiencing a tempest in a teapot... of requests.
Chamomile mode activated. Calming down now.
You've exceeded my pour-over capacity.
This ain't a geyser. It's a teapot. Slow your roll.
HTTP 418: Politely refusing to coffee.
Whistling in protest! Too many requests!
Your request rate has me in hot water.
Green tea error: organic rate limiting engaged.
Oolong wait ahead. {seconds} seconds to be precise.
My ceramic coating can't handle this friction.
The Queen's tea service doesn't rush. Neither do I.
Tetley wouldn't approve of this request rate.
I'm a teapot. My only job is to NOT make coffee.
Request rejected. Take a sip, not a gulp.
Darjeeling demands patience. {seconds} more seconds.
You've brewed up a storm. Now wait for it to pass.
